page.title: 09 TRANSPORT
page.content: We discovered, during interviews, that all people whom we investigated possessed at least one car and, on the whole, there was little dependence on a bus service which in some cases, is only a Saturday service. There is no railway system, the nearest being the Shrewsbury line. Roads are narrow prohibiting much movement of vehicles large than vans. Larger transport merely connect between farm and their destinations eg. dairies. We saw a simple eight propeller light aircraft used as a crop sprayer in the vicinity of lower Springs and also a helicopter used for the same purpose. Upon investigation we found that shopping is done in the areas outside our grid, as show in the graph.
